programme.title: The Stitchery: Coffee. Macrame. Dyeing. Tangents.
programme.desc: Trying to macrame a coffee cup and then dying it with real coffee

programme.title: The Stitchery: Recreating Centuries Old Embroidery
programme.desc: A dive into Jacobean crewel to add embroidery to a handmade skirt

programme.title: The Stitchery: I'm Remaking My EPIC Beauty and the Beast Embroidery... but Bigger! [Part 1]
programme.desc: A walk through the beginning steps of a huge embroidery

programme.title: The Stitchery: This Rug is LACE
programme.desc: Armenian needle lace done with chunky yarn to create a full area rug

programme.title: The Stitchery: Hot Air Balloon Macrame
programme.desc: Charlie attempts to make a hot air balloon macrame wall hanging.

programme.title: The Stitchery: Making a Macrame Chandelier in One Day (Almost)
programme.desc: My first attempt at making my own lamp

programme.title: Pure Design: Lee & Stevie's Living/Dining Room
programme.desc: Creating a living space that works for both kids and adults shouldn't mean you have to compromise on grown-up style. By using natural fibers and turning tired items into fabulous new centerpieces, Samantha Pynn transforms a living/dining room from a playroom into a glamorous living space that's sophisticated enough for a busy working mom yet playful enough for her young daughter.

programme.title: Pure Design: Helen & Niall's Nursery
programme.desc: Homeowners Helen and Niall are getting nervous - they're a few short months away from the birth of their first child and their never-renovated 1920s home doesn't contain a nursery. Both work full time - so they're relying on designer Samantha Pynn to create a bright and practical room for their new bundle of joy.

programme.title: Pure Design: Alexis & Adam's Kitchen
programme.desc: Alexis and Adam are in lifestyle shock: the arrival their son Hudson has meant that this formerly 'out and about' couple is now decidedly housebound but their 1980s kitchen just isn't happening anymore. It's neither practical nor beautiful so designer Samantha Pynn gives it an eco-friendly and stylish makeover. By taking out the dated metallic back-splash, lacquering their cabinets and updating the furnishings, Samantha converts an open kitchen and living area into a stunning space that is both functional for everyday use and glamorous enough for entertaining.

programme.title: Pure Design: Liliana and Frank's Living/Dining Room
programme.desc: Frank and Liliana's 1930s home gets fast-forwarded to the 21st century as designer Samantha Pynn uses environmentally friendly furniture and fresh accessories to update the look of classic English Revival.

programme.title: Pure Design: Ania & Walter's Master Bedroom
programme.desc: Too much space is not always a good thing, but with a little planning, designer Samantha Pynn is able to transform Ania and Walter's vast bedroom into a luxurious, earth-friendly boudoir.

programme.title: Pure Design: Lindsay's Teenage Bedroom
programme.desc: Designer Samantha Pynn creates an eco-fabulous bedroom for 16-year-old Lindsay that perfectly balances youthful without looking childish - and still allows for room to grow.

programme.title: Pure Design: Carolyn & Derek's Attic Loft
programme.desc: Designer Samantha Pynn transforms an unimaginative third floor loft into a fun, colorful, bohemian-inspired family room that matches homeowners Carolyn and Derek's personalities.

programme.title: She's Crafty: Eco Weddings
programme.desc: Knitting a laptop bag; reinventing ways to reuse an old shirt.

programme.title: She's Crafty: Craft Outside the Box
programme.desc: Joined by her closest friends, Wendy shows us some simple crafts to add to our collection.

programme.title: Appalachian Handcrafts: Preparing the Materials
programme.desc: Emileigh offers a mindful approach to preparing materials for Appalachian style whisk brooms.

programme.title: Appalachian Handcrafts: Crafting the Solid Style Broom
programme.desc: Emileigh offers a mindful approach to crafting a solid Appalachian style whisk broom.

programme.title: Appalachian Handcrafts: Crafting the V Style Broom
programme.desc: Emileigh offers a mindful approach to crafting a V style Appalachian whisk broom.

programme.title: Appalachian Handcrafts: Devotion to the Beauty of the Ordinary
programme.desc: Emileigh offers a mindful approach on how to prepare to craft Appalachian style whisk brooms.

programme.title: Appalachian Handcrafts: Intention Setting & Meditation
programme.desc: Emileigh offers a mindful approach on how to prepare to craft Appalachian style whisk brooms.

programme.title: Appalachian Handcrafts: More About the Artist
programme.desc: Get to know Emileigh - master crafter of Appalachian whisk brooms.

programme.title: Essence of India: The Sweet Life
programme.desc: Indian’s dessert food may have taken a back seat to some of its popular main courses, but Samira finds out about the spectacular buffet of desserts on offer before making some in her own kitchen.

programme.title: Essence of India: You Are What You Eat - Detox The Indian Way
programme.desc: In this episode, between learning how to cook healthy, wholesome meals, we learn the true meaning of yoga in the birthplace of the ancient practice.

programme.title: Essence of India: Feasting on Art - Modern India Cooks!
programme.desc: We seek out outstanding chefs who emphasize new techniques in Indian food preparation, to the point that it becomes difficult to know where the art ends and the food begins.

programme.title: Essence of India: Global Influences On Indian Food
programme.desc: In this episode, between elephant rides and a lovely lesson from musicians, we squeeze in a few incredible cuisines, and give you some truly authentic, delectable, mouth-watering recipes.

programme.title: Essence of India: My Big Fat Indian Wedding
programme.desc: In India a wedding may just hold the secret to the Essence of India - for this is where it all comes together - weddings are the most auspicious and celebrated events in family life.

programme.title: Essence of India: Brunch - Indian Style
programme.desc: Sunday Brunch is a Western concept, one I’ve enjoyed very much in my twelve years in Manhattan, and the idea is rapidly making inroads into an even more rapidly developing young India.

programme.title: The Stitchery: Coffee. Macrame. Dyeing. Tangents.
programme.desc: Trying to macrame a coffee cup and then dying it with real coffee

programme.title: The Stitchery: Recreating Centuries Old Embroidery
programme.desc: A dive into Jacobean crewel to add embroidery to a handmade skirt
